metadata.department: Department of Computer Science and Engineering

sections.About: The course gives an introduction to, and practice in, creation of different types of prototypes in Interaction Design. The contents cover both physical prototypes (e.g. paper prototypes, prototyping through controllers and micro-controllers, and prototyping through tinkering and physical modelling) and digital, screen-based prototypes (sketching and video prototypes). The course also gives an understanding of what to test with different prototypes, and when.
sections.Entry requirements: To be eligible for the course the student must have a Bachelor degree of 180 credits. Additionally, a course in Human - computer interaction, 7.5 credits, is required. Applicants must prove knowledge of English: English 6/English B or the equivalent level of an internationally recognized test, for example TOEFL, IELTS.
sections.Selection: Selection is based upon the number of credits from previous university studies, maximum 285 credits
sections.Tuition:
Full education cost: 17 753 SEK

First payment: 17 753 SEK

**No fees** are charged for EU and EEA citizens, Swedish residence permit holders and exchange students.

[More information about tuition fees](https://www.gu.se/en/study-in-gothenburg/apply/tuition-fees)

Application closed, late application opens 15 July 2025.
